concept.title: What are sessions with the Comms Database
concept.shortdesc: This topic describes the use of sessions to access the Comms Database.

conbody.p: Tools and applications create and use a session to access the Comms Database. A session is an instance of the class CMDBSession. An instance of CMDBSession acts as a handle to the database. The functions provided by MMetaDatabase to access the Comms Database require an instance of CMDBSession.
You must create a session before you get data from the Comms Database and before you update the Comms Database. To create a session, you create an instance of the CMDBSession class.
You delete the session after you finish your use of the Comms Database. To delete a session, you delete the instance of the CMDBSession class.
